subject: Re: Digest Number 1841
msgSnippet: ... I suspect that s because you see the tool a test generator.  It isn t. When I work with people I try and teach them how to use agitation as an exploratory
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Robert Martin <UncleBob@...> wrote:
>
> I've struggled with this myself. Agitar has some very cool
> capabilities, but I can't figure out when I'd actually use them.
> ... I don't really know when I'd use the agitation.
>

I suspect that's because you see the tool a test generator. It isn't.

When I work with people I try and teach them how to use agitation as
an exploratory tool to drive improvements in their code. Most of the
improvements fall into one of two categories:

1. standard refactorings like extract method or introducing
dependency injection,
2. changes to more completely express their domain model, such as
introducing a constraint or a new type

In a given agitation mentoring session that's how we'll spend the bulk
of the time and at the end of it the code is (hopefully) improved.

Oh yes, and we'll also create tests and probably fix some bugs, but
most of the time is spent thinking and talking about design.

Jtf
